If you're looking for something a bit more subtle and character-driven, "Remember Me, My Love" might be up your alley. It's a beautifully shot Italian film that explores the complexities of relationships and family dynamics in a thoughtful and nuanced way.

I think I have just the right recommendations for you!

If you're looking for a war-themed movie that explores what happens when events take an unexpected turn, I'd recommend "Tora! Tora! Tora!" (1970). This historical drama is based on real events and offers a gripping portrayal of the 1941 Japanese air raid on Pearl Harbor. You'll get to see some talented actors like James Whitmore and Martin Balsam bring these pivotal moments to life.

Alternatively, if you're in the mood for something more thought-provoking that delves into themes of war's aftermath, "The Best Years of Our Lives" (1946) is a classic film that explores the experiences of three World War II veterans as they readjust to civilian life. With powerful performances by Dana Andrews and Myrna Loy, this movie will leave you reflecting on the human cost of war.

Let me know if either of these piques your interest!
